definition: photo taken during a theatrical production/a still (from a movie)
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before

sentences.english: The documentary uses original stills and archive footage.
sentences.chinese: 这部纪录片采用了原始剧照和档案胶片。

sentences.english: Now we are seeing is the stills Wei Hushan City Hall.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们看到的是威虎山城剧照馆。

sentences.english: We had a slew of cast photos pinged with copyright infringement violations.
sentences.chinese: 我们曾有一些涉及侵犯版权的剧照。

sentences.english: This work is based on a still photo in Jiang Wenli's film .
sentences.chinese: 该画源于蒋雯丽电影《我们天上见》里的一张剧照。

sentences.english: The young star is captured in an old film still.
sentences.chinese: 在这张老电影的剧照中，一颗新星已闪亮登场。

sentences.english: This was the plot of “The Day after Tomorrow”.
sentences.chinese: 这是电影《后天》的情景剧照。

sentences.english: I think the only thing that makes the film worth watching are the handful of picturesque stills of the wilderness.
sentences.chinese: 我认为这部电影唯一的看点就是大量美丽的沙漠剧照。

sentences.english: Judging from these new photos, Klaus is quite the attention-grabber at homecoming.
sentences.chinese: 从这些最新的剧照来看，克劳斯在返校节上备受关注。

definition: to act the leading role (in a movie or a play)/to star/lead actor
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
cast (of a movie etc)/lineup of performers/troupe
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
